cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest through the Bahamas tonight, then turning north-northwest and riding just offshore the Florida east coast before lifting toward the Georgia and South Carolina coasts early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Florida coast (around Boca Raton – West Palm Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Hallandale Beach FL to Boca Raton FL and from the Volusia-Brevard County line FL to the Flagler-Volusia County line FL. Tropical Storm Watch from Flagler-Volusia County line FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL. Storm Surge Watch Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Boca Raton FL to the Volusia-Brevard County line FL; Central and Northwestern Bahamas. Tropical Storm Warning North of Ocean Reef to Boca Raton FL and Lake Okeechobee.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from South Florida northward through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible Monday with peak chances of 10% (34-kt threshold) and little risk of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible but generally expected to remain below 3 ft along the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain forecast for coastal Georgia as the storm passes offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents and rough seas that will affect vessel traffic and cargo operations.
